mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sullivan, James, 1744-1808
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Dares intrude to state that Jefferson's friends in New England who are many will be disappointed if he declines being vice president; any abuse he may receive comes from party who abuse everyone who will not bow to British monarchy; if such abuse deprives public of services of those on whom they may confide with safety the enemies of an elective Republic will triumph.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1797 January 12, Boston, [Massachusetts] to [Thomas] Jefferson, n.p.
